title: Best of Rivalry Week: Saturday's results offered a healthy dose of certainty
content: The final chapter of the 2025 regular season didn't upend the status quo, but it did give us plenty of answers.

title: Sources: LSU expected to hire Kiffin on Sunday
content: Sources told ESPN late Saturday that the expectation is LSU, a day after its regular season ended, will hire Ole Miss coach Lane Kiffin, 50, on Sunday as its new coach and that the deal will cover seven seasons at an annual average of around $12 million.

title: Bama wins Iron Bowl, to face Georgia for SEC title
content: No. 10 Alabama escaped Auburn with a 27-20 victory and will face No. 4 Georgia in the Southeastern Conference championship game next week in Atlanta.

title: Freeman touts Irish's case: Who's best right now?
content: Notre Dame coach Marcus Freeman said his team's inclusion in the College Football Playoff is straightforward, arguing that it's hard to argue the Irish aren't one of the nation's best teams right now.

title: Belichick's debut UNC season ends in rivalry loss
content: Bill Belichick's debut season at North Carolina ended with a blowout loss to rival NC State, capping a 4-8 campaign filled with struggles for the Tar Heels.

title: UVA clinches spot, to face Duke in ACC title game
content: No. 18 Virginia beat Virginia Tech 27-7 on Saturday night to clinch a spot in the Atlantic Coast Conference championship game, where they will face Duke.

title: Mavs' Flagg leaps LeBron as youngest to score 35
content: The Mavericks raved about rookie Cooper Flagg's "limitless" upside after he became the youngest player in NBA history to score 35 points, achieving the feat Saturday night in a 114-110 win over the Clippers.

title: Miami, Messi to host Vancouver in first MLS final
content: Inter Miami advanced to MLS Cup following a commanding 5-1 victory over New York City FC, sparked by Tadeo Allende's hat trick on Saturday.

title: 'Zero percent chance I walk,' says UK's Stoops
content: Kentucky coach Mark Stoops says there's a "zero percent chance" he's walking away from the Wildcats after a disappointing 4-8 season in Lexington.

title: Final prep for NFL Week 13: We have sleepers, QB questions, trends to watch and more
content: Should we be concerned about Brock Purdy? Could the Titans and Browns pull off upsets? And is Trevor Lawrence startable in fantasy in Week 13?

title: Week 13 inactives: C.J. Stroud, Baker Mayfield expected under center
content: Updated inactives and analysis based on the latest reports and official announcements leading up to kickoff.

title: A reunion at Stanford and trolling at the Egg Bowl lead Week 14 superlatives
content: As expected, college football's rivalry week brought plenty in the department of unconventionality. We handed out nontraditional superlatives for the chaotic weekend.

title: Flamengo lift Copa Libertadores, but Brazil's players look exhausted
content: Originally billed as the "final of the century," Saturday's Libertadores decider was a war of attrition -- mainly because Brazil's two top clubs are struggling to contend with a ridiculous match schedule.

title: WNBA CBA negotiations: What happens if there's no deal at the end of the 30 days?
content: How far apart are the two sides and what if a deal isn't in place by the Sunday WNBA deadline for a new CBA?

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United to move for Real Madrid's Valverde
content: Manchester United are exploring a move for Real Madrid midfielder Federico Valverde. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: 23XI vs. NASCAR trial: Why Michael Jordan & Co. want to tear up stock car racing
content: The antitrust suit against NASCAR goes to court on Monday, in a trial that could tear at the fabric of stock car racing as we know it.

title: Disruption in A320 operations: Karnataka travel operators’ body warns of economic and employment crisis
content: KSTOA has expressed concern that State tourism revenues could fall sharply, hampering a fragile post-pandemic recovery that many operators are still struggling through

title: Bharatiya Kala Mahotsav at Rashtrapati Nilayam closes with 1.8 lakh visitors, ₹2.5 crore sales
content: Visitors faced a waiting line of nearly 100 metres at the entrance as they queued up to experience the cultural and traditional displays of the western States

title: Kanaka Durga temple witnesses heavy devotee turnout
content: Large number of devotees participate in ‘Arjitha Sevas’, including ‘Surya Upasana’, ‘Chandi Homam’, and ‘Laksha Kumkuma Archana’, while the temple ensures distribution of free ‘prasadam’ and ‘annaprasadam’ to all visitors

title: Anbumani writes to Chandrababu Naidu seeking 6% quota for Vanniyars in A.P.
content: He says out of the total 6.5 crore population of the State, the combined share of the communities is 9.34%, but their representation in education and government employment is estimated to be less than 2%

title: Cyclone Ditwah: Energy Minister directs officials to prevent power disruptions
content: Ensure immediate restoration of electricity in case of interruptions, Gottipati Ravi Kumar tells officials

title: Air Force Station-Begumpet holds graduation ceremony for navigation, weapon systems courses
content: The flight cadets will be commissioned as officers in the Indian Air Force at the Combined Graduation Parade scheduled to be held at the Air Force Academy, Dundigal on December 13

title: Boseraju holds talks with Andhra Pradesh Ministers on bridge-cum-barrage
content: Such a facility has been proposed to come up across the Tungabhadra near Chikalapravi and Chikkamanchale in Raichur district

title: TDPP wants ECI to take up SIR at the earliest in  Andhra Pradesh
content: The party also wants Parliament to discuss about allocation of Krishna waters and rationalisation of GST rates, and the plight of cotton, maize, banana and aqua farmers, says TDPP  leader Lavu Sri Krishna Devarayalu

title: Burglary case suspect shot in leg by Coimbatore City Police dies in hospital
content: A senior police officer says reasons for his death will be ascertained after the post-mortem. His accomplices, who were also apprehended after being shot in the leg, are undergoing treatment

title: Pak Shifted 72 Terror Launchpads, Forces Ready For Operation Sindoor 2.0: BSF
content: More than six dozen terror launchpads have been shifted to the "depth areas" in Pakistan after Operation Sindoor, and the force is ready to inflict heavy losses on the enemy if the government decides to resume the operation, said senior BSF officers.

title: Hong Kong Fire Death Count Rises To 146, Several Remain Missing
content: The death count in Hong Kong's apartment complex blaze rose to 146 on Sunday as investigators discovered more bodies in the burned-out buildings.

title: Indonesia Residents Steal Food, Water For Survival Amid Floods
content: Some residents of the flood-hit Indonesian island of Sumatra have resorted to stealing food and water to survive, authorities said Sunday, while Sri Lankan officials said deaths from floods and mudslides in that island nation have risen to 193.

title: 62-Year-Old Retired Cop Dies After Being Attacked By Swarm Of Bees In UP
content: 62-year-old retired police officer died after being attacked by a swarm of bees here on Sunday, officials said.

title: Cyclone Ditwah To Intensify Rainfall Across Andhra Pradesh: Weather Office
content: The IMD on Sunday said cyclone Ditwah, positioned over the southwest Bay of Bengal, is likely to intensify rainfall across several districts of Andhra Pradesh.

title: Athlete Brutally Killed By Mob For Calling Out Indecent Behaviour At Wedding
content: A national-level para-athlete from Haryana's Rohtak district died of his injuries two days after a group of men brutally beat him up with iron rods and hockey sticks after he objected to their alleged indecent behaviour at a wedding.

title: 10 Killed, 20 Injured After 2 Passenger Buses Collide In Tamil Nadu
content: At least 10 people were killed and 20 others injured after two Tamil Nadu government buses collided head-on near Kummangudi in Sivaganga district on Sunday evening, police said.

title: Benjamin Netanyahu Submits 'Pardon Request' To Israeli President Over Corruption Cases
content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, on trial facing corruption charges, announced Sunday he had submitted a pardon request, saying the long-running cases were tearing the country apart.

title: Watch: Turkey's Unmanned Jet Makes History With Radar-Guided Air-To-Air Kill
content: Kizilelma destroyed a jet-powered aerial target identified by Aselsan's Murad Aesa radar with a Beyond Visual Range air-to-air Gokdogan missile.

title: US Officials Meeting Ukraine Negotiators As Trump Pushes To End Russia War
content: Top Trump administration officials are meeting Ukrainian negotiators in Florida this weekend, pushing to broker an end to Russia's war in Ukraine and setting the stage for key talks planned this week in Moscow with Russian leader Vladimir Putin.

title: Over 500 Dead Across Southeast Asia Amid Floods, Landslides
content: The death count mounted to over 500 from floods and landslides caused by torrential rains across three countries in Southeast Asia, officials said on Sunday, as relief efforts for tens of thousands of displaced people continued over the weekend.

title: "Love Lives": Woman 'Marries' Lover's Body After Family Kills Him Over Caste
content: When Aanchal's brothers and father learned that she was going to marry Tate, they beat him up on Thursday, shot him in the head and crushed his head with a stone.

title: Rajasthan Was Going To Celebrate Babri Demolition, Then Pulled Back
content: After deciding to celebrate the demolition of the Babri Masjid as Shaurya Diwas on December 6, the Rajasthan government reversed course and withdrew its order, terming it "brahmak" or confusing.

title: Video: Kicks, Punches Rained On Man Inside Bhopal Pharmacy Council Premises
content: The victim, identified as Tushar Sunar,had been visiting the Council office for over a month to obtain a digital signature on his certificate.

title: Opposition Wants SIR Debate In Parliament, Centre Seeks Smooth Conduct
content: Leaders of the ruling National Democratic Alliance (NDA) government and Opposition parties are already fighting a war of words outside parliament a day before the winter session begins.

title: 1 Killed After Speeding Mercedes Rams 3 Near South Delhi Mall
content: A speeding Mercedes ran over a man and injured two others in a posh locality in Delhi last night. The incident occurred after midnight in the Vasant Kunj area near Ambience Mall, police said.

title: Cyclone Ditwah Brings Heavy Rain In Tamil Nadu, Rescuers On Standby
content: Cyclone Ditwah has triggered rain in several araes of Tamil Nadu as it is expected to move parallel to the coastline of the northern parts of the state and Puducherry in the next 24 hours.

title: 71-Year-Old Hyderabad Man Loses Nearly Rs 2 Crore To Digital Arrest Scam
content: In another digital arrest case, Cybercrime Police of Hyderabad have nabbed three fraudsters who extorted Rs 1.92 crore from a senior citizen.

title: ‘Gurajada Visista Puraskaram’ presented to noted writer Kolakaluri Enoch
content: The writings of Gurajada Apparao will continue to inspire the generations to come as they are relevant for society forever, says Justice Manavendranath Roy

title: Unlicensed medical shop raided in Khammam, 101 varieties of medicines seized
content: Seized stock valued at around ₹30,000; samples have been collected for analysis and further investigation is under way

title: Hyderabad’s NTR Stadium turns sea of faith as thousands observe 350th martyrdom of Guru Tegh Bahadur
content: Guru Tegh Bahadur, often revered as ‘Hind Di Chadar’ (or the Shield of India) stood firm against oppression and fought for the right of every individual to practice their religion freely

title: Yanamala calls for steps to remove cap on quota for BCs
content: The Constitution needs to be amended or, alternatively, the States should file petitions in the Supreme Court seeking a review of its order that imposed a cap of 50%

title: Rain, floods in low-lying areas disrupt life across Karaikal district
content: Flood water enters several houses in villages across the district; water has drained in some villages leaving behind a thick layer of silt; work is on in full swing in flood-hit areas

title: Putthige Mutt seer seeks metro rail between Udupi and Mangaluru, national recognition for Kambala
content: Udupi Paryaya Putthige Mutt submitted a memorandum to Prime Minister Narendra Modi in Udupi on November 28 placing eight demands for comprehensive development of Udupi district

title: All-party meeting: Opposition demands debate on SIR, national security in Parliament
content: Opposition parties also strongly pressed for a discussion on national security in the wake of the Delhi blast incident

title: Thousands of e-khata applications pending in Bengaluru as software failures and staffing shortages persist
content: While the software does not indicate why an application has been rejected, shortage of IT staff within the GBA to resolve technical issues has further compounded the problem.

title: Even husbands don’t give ₹100: Minister asks Ladki Bahin beneficiaries to back Maharashtra CM
content: “When you cast your votes, don't forget the ₹1,500 given by Devabhau (Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis); Stay loyal,” BJP leader Jaykumar Gore said

title: Experts attribute spike in AQI in Mumbai to construction activities, vehicular pollution
content: BMC said various steps are being undertaken to address air pollution, including forcing bakeries and crematoriums to use cleaner fuels, introducing electric buses, managing construction debris scientifically, and using machines for sprinkling water on roads to control dust.

title: Congress hiding Rahul Mamkootathil, claims CPI(M) State secretary Govindan
content: Affidavit submitted by the Palakkad MLA in the court as part of his anticipatory bail plea is an admission of his guilt, says Govindan

title: Kumbakonam’s Nageswaran Temple and ‘Mogamul’: an exchange of ideas between Carnatic and Hindustani music
content: For lovers of books and music, the Nageswaran Temple at Kumbakonam is inseparable from T. Janakiraman’s ‘Mogamul’ and the soul-stirring music of the Hindustani performers from Maharashtra.

title: 37 Maoists surrender in Chhattisgarh’s Dantewada
content: In the past few days, there have been mass surrenders in Dantewada, Narayanpur, Sukma, Bastar, and Bijapur districts in Chhattisgarh

title: Bihar poll debacle sparks blame-game between RJD, Congress
content: Prominent among those who disclosed the "sentiment of most of the 61 candidates", of whom, incidentally, only six tasted victory, was Shakeel Ahmed Khan, the Congress legislative party leader in the outgoing Assembly

title: A.R. Rahman to inaugurate Music Academy’s 99th annual festival
content: The Academy has long debated the importance of film music and its appeal to the general public and connoisseurs. This year marks the 250th anniversary of Muthuswami Dikshitar, one of the trinities of Carnatic music

title: EC realised SIR exercise cannot be completed in short time: Congress
content: Congress leader and party's deputy leader in Rajya Sabha Pramod Tiwari told reporters that the EC and the Election Commission should shed ego and hold the exercise as per the schedule of 2003

title: Manipur's violence-hit people hold demonstration near Raj Bhavan, seeking to return home
content: “The Sangai festival is being held by claiming normalcy while ignoring the plights of the displaced persons," a displaced person from Churachandpur district said.

title: AMNSIL steel plant in A.P. lines up a portfolio of six products
content: The company is in the process of getting the 244 km-long iron ore slurry pipeline from NMDC’s Bailadila mines in Chhattisgarh up to the main plant site at Rajayyapeta

title: Woman constable found dead in Uttar Pradesh's Aligarh
content: “The woman was identified as Hemlata (31), a native of Agra district, and she was posted at Rorawar police station in Aligarh,” the police said

title: Some Bharatiya people don't know our own languages: RSS chief Bhagwat
content: "There was a time when communication and daily business was in Sanskrit. Now, some American professor teaches us Sanskrit, when in reality we should be teaching it to the world,” Mr. Bhagwat said

title: Cyber Crime Unit arrests three in ₹1.92 crore digital arrest scam
content: “Victim was threatened with a fabricated case involving the misuse of his Aadhaar number and was coerced into transferring money to multiple bank accounts after being shown forged documents and a fake ATM card,” says officer

title: Cyclone Ditwah: 177 people stranded in Sri Lanka return to Tamil Nadu, State government to send relief
content: Chief Minister M.K. Stalin announced that the Tamil Nadu government was prepared to join the Government of India to extend relief measures as the cyclone has left behind a huge trail of destruction.

title: Proposal for new design of border fencing under consideration of Centre: BSF IG
content: India shares a 4,096 km international border with Bangladesh, out of which Tripura has 856 km border with the neighbouring country

title: Mann ki Baat: Dedication of India's youth greatest strength of 'Viksit Bharat', says PM Modi
content: The PM spoke at length about bee farming initiatives across the country, achievements in the field of sports, India winning the bid for hosting the Commonwealth Games in 2030, and his visits to South Africa for the G-20 Summit and Bhutan

title: ECI extends schedule of ongoing SIR in 12 States and UTs by a week
content: Final voter list after SIR would now be out on Feb. 14, draft list on Dec. 16 and enumeration phase will continue till Dec. 11

title: Cyclone Ditwah: Three persons die in rain-related incidents in Tamil Nadu
content: While two persons died due to wall collapse in Thanjavur and Thoothukudi districts, one died due to electrocution in Mayiladuthurai district

title: Rape investigation against Mamkootathil gathers pace as police inspect his residence in Palakkad
content: Investigators emphasised that digital evidence, chiefly incriminating voice recordings and text messages, was vital to the case

title: India played leadership role at U.N. COP30 climate summit, achieved all major goals: Bhupender Yadav
content: Union Environment Minister Bhupender Yadav said India successfully positioned itself as a leader of the BASIC (Brazil, South Africa, India, China) Group and the bloc of Like-Minded Developing Countries (LMDC)

title: CAG terms Assam budget 2023-24 ‘unrealistic’; questions excessive supplementary grants
content: The report further pointed out that supplementary grants of a total of ₹30,210.86 crore were approved by the legislature for 2023-24, whereas audit analysis of utilisation of these grants showed that only 74.19% of it was required.

title: Indian airlines complete software upgrades for 323 operational A320 family planes
content: Air India had 113 affected aircraft and out of them, the upgrades have been done for the operational 100 planes while four are under base maintenance and nine aircraft did not require the modifications, as per the official

title: Winter Session: Opposition united in demanding discussion on SIR; government seeks cooperation
content: The customary meeting has been convened to ensure smooth functioning of the two Houses during the session where several new bills are planned to be introduced

title: The Archives at NCBS announces call for sixth Obaid Siddiqi Chair
content: Individuals around the world can apply, with no restrictions on the applicant’s discipline or on levels of education completed.

title: HC directs Rajasthan Govt to encourage ride-hailing apps to have 15% women drivers in 6 months
content: “The platforms must offer women passengers the option to choose a woman driver as their first preference,” the Court order said.

title: Opposition to raise 'vote chori', Red Fort blast issues in Winter Session: Pramod Tiwari
content: "When a blast is happening near the Red Fort, that is an issue. Prime Minister Narendra Modi's foreign policy has gone haywire. All these issues will be raised," says Congress leader Pramod Tiwari

title: Parliament Winter session: Govt to push reform agenda, Opposition to take on govt over SIR
content: Besides the crucial 'The Atomic Energy Bill, 2025', which seeks to govern the use and regulation of atomic energy in India, the Higher Education Commission of India Bill and eight other draft legislations are also on the agenda

title: Cyclone Ditwah: Young woman dies, three injured in wall collapse near Kumbakonam
content: Due to continuous heavy rain, wall of the old house collapsed around 11.30 p.m. and fell onto the asbestos-roof building where the family was sleeping.

title: VACB recommends Kerala PSC to conduct aided-school appointments to stop corruption
content: The agency insisted that aided-school managements publish information on appointments in the disability category for official scrutiny, to ensure compliance with the law

title: Cyclone Ditwah: Deputy CM Udhayanidhi reviews emergency measures; 10 more NDRF teams to be deployed across T.N.
content: As many as 16 State Disaster Response Force (SDRF) teams and 12 National Disaster Response Force (NDRF) teams have been currently deployed in coastal districts

title: Hong Kong fire: Anger over 146 deaths spills on to streets; China slaps sedition law
content: Public anger over Hong Kong's deadliest fire has led to protests demanding accountability. Student activist Miles Kwan, who called for an independent investigation, was reportedly detained under the national security law. Authorities accused "anti-China forces" of exploiting the tragedy, while activists argue the inferno was a preventable disaster.

title: ‘Immortal love’: Teen marries boyfriend’s corpse; family booked for caste killing
content: A teenage girl in Nanded performed symbolic wedding rituals with her murdered boyfriend's body after her father and brothers were arrested for his killing over their inter-caste relationship. The girl, Aanchal, stated her family opposed their union due to caste differences and vowed to live with her deceased lover's mother.

title: Big govt order: WA, Telegram told to link services to SIM cards; what it means for users
content: India's Union government mandates SIM card verification and six-hour session timeouts for messaging apps to combat cyber fraud. Platforms like WhatsApp and Telegram must ensure continuous SIM linkage, blocking access if the original SIM is absent. This directive aims to enhance telecom cybersecurity by preventing misuse from outside the country.

title: Thousands of Amazon employees send open letter to CEO; question layoffs
content: Over 1,000 Amazon employees have signed an open letter warning of dire consequences from the company's rapid AI development. They argue Amazon is sacrificing climate goals and its human workforce for AI dominance, citing increased emissions, water consumption for data centers, and job displacement. The workers demand ethical AI practices, including clean energy use and employee involvement in AI decisions.

title: IND vs SA: Fan breaches security and falls at Virat Kohli's feet - Watch
content: Virat Kohli's record-breaking 52nd ODI century powered India to 349/8 against South Africa. The star batsman's 135, supported by Rohit Sharma's 57 and KL Rahul's 60, formed the backbone of the innings. However, the standout moment after the veteran's ton came when a pitch invader briefly interrupted the celebrations but was quickly removed by officials.

title: Explained: How India's Rupee ended up as Asia's worst currency this year
content: India's currency is facing a sharp decline in 2025. What are the top reasons behind? Is it the trade disputes with the US or the reduced foreign investment or the Reserve Bank of India's managing of the situation with a restrained approach. What is making the rupee's value fall significantly this year?

title: Indonesia floods: Toll rises to 442, hundreds missing; warships deployed for rescue ops
content: Indonesia's death toll from severe floods and landslides has reached 442, with hundreds missing and injured, as two cities on Sumatra remain unreachable. Thailand is also grappling with devastating floods, having claimed 162 lives, while Malaysia continues to shelter thousands displaced by the monsoon. Climate change is cited as a factor intensifying these deadly weather events.

title: Wage Shift in AI Era: Kevin O’Leary to students; creative storytelling now beats engineering
content: Shark Tank investor Kevin O'Leary has reversed his advice to students, now highlighting creative storytelling and content creation as the fastest-growing wage earners. He stated that elite content creators are achieving significant incomes by driving online sales and reducing customer acquisition costs, a stark contrast to his previous emphasis on engineering degrees.

title: Russell's retirement: SRK quips - 'Any other jersey would look weird on you'
content: Andre Russell has retired from the Indian Premier League. Kolkata Knight Riders co-owner Shah Rukh Khan shared a tribute. Russell will now serve as KKR's power coach. He had a significant career with the team. KKR aims for a better season and has a large purse for the upcoming auction.

title: ‘Incredible potential’: British Airways eyeing expansion in India, says COO
content: British Airways is significantly boosting its India operations, adding a third daily flight to Delhi next year. Citing "incredible potential" and strong outbound travel demand, the airline sees India as its second-largest market. This expansion includes local hiring and a robust contact center, underscoring a commitment to the growing Indian aviation sector.

title: Gmail storage hack: How to keep inbox running smoothly - Check details
content: Running out of Gmail storage is a common issue, often exacerbated by connected Google services like Drive and Photos.  This article outlines practical steps to clear space, including emptying trash, deleting large attachments, and utilizing the Google One Storage Manager.  Adopting smart habits can prevent future storage problems and maintain optimal performance.

title: Earthquake: 4.4-magnitude quake hits Nepal’s Bajhang; no damages reported
content: A 4.4-magnitude earthquake jolted Nepal's Bajhang district in Sudur Paschim province on Sunday afternoon. The tremors, originating from the Saipal mountain region, were also felt in nearby western districts. No immediate reports of damage or casualties have been issued.

title: 'Pushed her off train': Navy officer’s wife found dead on rly tracks; TTE booked
content: A woman, Arti Yadav, wife of a Navy officer, died after allegedly being pushed from a train by a TTE in Etawah. She had boarded the wrong train due to a delay. Witnesses claim the TTE threw her luggage and pushed her. Her father alleges murder, while police are investigating, considering the possibility she jumped.

title: Bibi’s corruption trial: Israeli PM seeks pardon; Prez calls request ‘extraordinary’
content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has formally requested a presidential pardon while his corruption trial is ongoing. President Isaac Herzog's office acknowledged the "extraordinary request" and stated it would be considered responsibly after reviewing all relevant opinions. The plea follows an appeal from US President Donald Trump.

title: SIR row: ECI pulls up Bengal govt for withholding BLOs honorarium, TMC rsponds
content: The Election Commission of India has criticized the West Bengal government for delaying increased honorariums for booth level officers (BLOs) and payments for the special intensive revision of electoral rolls. This comes as the TMC delegation accused the ECI of having "blood on their hands" over the revision process.

title: IND vs SA: Tendulkar surpassed! Kohli becomes only cricketer to earn this record
content: Virat Kohli achieved a historic milestone with his 52nd ODI century against South Africa. He now holds the record for most centuries in a single international format. Kohli's masterful innings provided India with a strong foundation. He displayed remarkable control and strokeplay on a challenging pitch. The crowd celebrated his achievement with a standing ovation.

title: Vanessa Bryant’s Disneyland adventure as her daughters steal the spotlight
content: Vanessa Bryant recently shared a heartwarming glimpse of a Disneyland outing with her daughters Natalia, Bianka, and Capri on Instagram. The philanthropist has been a steadfast presence for her girls, balancing their needs with her own grief. Bryant expressed immense pride in Natalia's resilience and maturity, highlighting her role as a supportive big sister and daughter.

title: PoK part of India, so trade across LoC intra-state: HC
content: Jammu and Kashmir High Court ruled cross-LoC trade as intra-state, asserting Pakistan-occupied Kashmir is part of the Union Territory. The court dismissed petitions from traders challenging GST notices, stating the trade was internal. This ruling comes after the Indian government suspended cross-LoC trade in 2019 due to misuse concerns.

title: Watch: IAF choppers rescue civilians in flood-hit Sri Lanka; C-130 joins relief ops
content: Under Operation Sagar Bandhu, Indian Chetak helicopters deployed from INS Vikrant conducted search and rescue missions in Sri Lanka following Cyclone Ditwah. India has reaffirmed its solidarity, delivering 27 tonnes of relief material and standing by Sri Lanka through its Neighbourhood First policy.

title: IND vs SA: Kohli punches air, roars with another ODI hundred
content: Virat Kohli showcased his class with a masterful century, anchoring India's innings to 233/4 in 38 overs against South Africa. His brilliant 103 off 102 balls, featuring six fours and five sixes, was complemented by a crucial 136-run partnership with Rohit Sharma. Kohli's composed knock ensured India remained on track for a substantial total.

title: Tere Ishq Mein Box Office Day 3: Dhanush-Kriti Sanon Film Hits Rs 39.82 Cr
content: Dhanush and Kriti Sanon's 'Tere Ishq Mein' has garnered significant praise and a strong box office performance. The film opened to ₹16 crore on Day 1 and maintained a steady pace, collecting ₹17 crore on Day 2, reaching a total of ₹33 crore. It continued its successful run on Sunday, adding ₹6.82 crore to reach ₹39.

title: 7 blasts in 24 hrs: Insurgents target trains, police; fear spreads in Pak's Balochistan
content: Balochistan province witnessed a wave of at least seven explosions in 24 hours, with insurgents targeting Quetta and Dera Murad Jamali. While no fatalities were reported, two security guards were injured. Attacks included grenade assaults on police checkpoints and an IED blast disrupting rail services, fueling fear across the region.

title: Bank holidays in December 2025: Check complete state-wise list
content: Banks nationwide will observe several holidays in December 2025, in addition to regular weekend closures. These closures, dictated by the RBI's festive and regional holiday calendar, will impact in-branch services. Online banking and UPI will remain operational throughout these observances.

title: Jaya Bachchan says she doesn’t care about being the ‘most hated person’ on social media
content: Veteran actress Jaya Bachchan has expressed her strong disapproval of paparazzi. She stated her relationship with them is zero, contrasting it with her respect for the media. Bachchan finds their intrusive behaviour unacceptable. She also mentioned she does not care about social media opinions. The actress recently refused to pose for photographers at an event.

title: History rewritten! Rohit smashes past Afridi to become leading six-hitter in ODIs
content: Rohit Sharma became the leading six-hitter in ODI history, surpassing Shahid Afridi with his 352nd six. He also registered his 60th ODI half-century. Alongside Virat Kohli, they achieved their 20th century partnership, further solidifying India's strong batting performance.

title: Wait… do I really need that bag, or is Instagram gaslighting me again?
content: A pervasive uniform aesthetic in consumer culture reflects a decline in individuality, driven by insecurity and the desire to belong. Brands and creators exploit this by selling ready-made identities, leading to overconsumption and environmental strain. This trend prioritises perception over utility, turning curated identities into disposable consumption.

title: 'Shadow fleet': India imported 5.4m tonnes of Russian oil; how Moscow dodged curbs
content: India received 5.4 million tonnes of Russian oil worth 2.1 billion euros via 30 vessels operating under false flags between January and September 2025, a report reveals. This highlights Russia's use of a growing 'shadow fleet' to bypass Western sanctions, with India being a major recipient of these oil shipments.

title: 'SC, Centre undermining minority': Madani's remarks cause stir — what Jamiat chief said
content: Maulana Mahmood Madani has ignited controversy with his remarks on the Supreme Court's handling of key cases and his views on 'jihad' and 'ghar wapsi'. His statements have drawn sharp criticism from the BJP and differing opinions within the Muslim community, highlighting a divided political landscape.

title: Leon Draisaitl’s sharp message puts fresh spotlight on Connor McDavid’s leadership
content: Leon Draisaitl responded with 'Lol' to criticism about Edmonton Oilers' leadership.  The podcast suggested top players like Draisaitl and Connor McDavid should provide more direction.  Despite past Stanley Cup Final appearances, the Oilers face defensive struggles this season.  Their offense remains strong with McDavid and Draisaitl.  Fans are divided on the criticism.  The team's on-ice performance will ultimately show leadership.

title: Kohli says no, Rohit walks: DRS moment steals spotlight
content: Rohit Sharma's impressive 57-run knock in the first ODI against South Africa was cut short by an LBW decision, which he chose not to review after consulting Virat Kohli. Despite the dismissal, Rohit etched his name in ODI history, surpassing Shahid Afridi's record for most sixes with his 352nd maximum. He also registered his 60th ODI half-century.

title: Kolkata: 90-year-old father dies in hospital as HC hears daughter’s plea for last meeting
content: A Kolkata businessman, aged over 90, passed away at a hospital on Saturday. This occurred as the Calcutta High Court heard a plea from his daughter seeking to visit him. The daughter, residing in Mumbai, had been denied access to her father. The court was informed of the businessman's death via live video by his wife.

title: Getting married in Haldwani? You can now hire cops to manage wedding traffic, crowds
content: Nainital Police have introduced a paid service allowing wedding hosts to hire uniformed personnel for traffic and crowd management during the marriage season. This initiative aims to prevent congestion caused by processions and guest vehicles, ensuring celebrations don't disrupt public movement. Organizers must also adhere to a 10 pm sound deadline and ensure adequate internal parking to avoid road obstructions.

title: 'Don't speak of it': Secrecy, strain before bizman's Bahu death; kin seek CBI probe
content: A woman married into a Delhi industrialist family was found dead, with an FIR detailing years of alleged abuse and intimidation. Her mother seeks a CBI inquiry after the woman's death, which followed a confrontation over her husband's alleged affair and subsequent mistreatment. Police have registered a case of abetment to suicide.

title: Parliament Winter Session: Oppn seeks debate on Delhi blast, SIR; govt ready to listen
content: Ahead of Parliament's Winter Session, an all-party meeting saw the Opposition demanding detailed discussions on national security, the "SIR" issue, pollution, farmers' concerns, and democracy. They expressed worries about the government's handling of key national matters and insisted on parliamentary debates. The government stated its readiness to listen to the Opposition's concerns during the session.

title: Noida shocker: Woman says no to marriage, ex-boyfriend shoots her dead
content: A 23-year-old woman was fatally shot by her ex-boyfriend in Noida after she refused his marriage proposal. The accused, Krishna, allegedly forced his way into her home and fired shots when she resisted. He then threatened neighbours before fleeing. Police have registered a murder case and are actively searching for the suspect.

title: Stop blaming Gambhir alone for India’s Test defeats: Former chief selector
content: Former chief selector Sandeep Patil strongly backs under-fire coach Gautam Gambhir, citing the complexities of the job and a lack of understanding from critics. Patil emphasized that pointing fingers at one person is unfair, especially when many critics haven't experienced coaching India themselves. He urged patience, highlighting that even successful coaches faced initial struggles, and Gambhir needs time to settle.

title: 'Know my limits': DKS says ‘no difference between me & CM' — Inside Karnataka's GoT
content: Karnataka Deputy Chief Minister DK Shivakumar asserted unity with Chief Minister Siddaramaiah, dismissing speculation about power-sharing disagreements. Following a meeting, Shivakumar emphasized their commitment to governance and future electoral goals, aiming for a repeat victory in 2028.  Both leaders presented a united front, attributing rumors to media and opposition.

title: Fortnite Chapter 7 skins: Full list and fastest ways to unlock them
content: Fortnite Chapter 7 Season 1 has launched with a Hollywood-themed Battle Pass, featuring iconic skins like Marty McFly and The Bride. Players can unlock these and other new characters, along with V-Bucks and cosmetic items, through a flexible progression system. The pass, costing 1,000 V-Bucks, offers over 100 rewards, encouraging players to explore different game modes for bonus unlocks.

title: IPL: Andre Russell retires - Returns to KKR in new role
content: Kolkata Knight Riders' explosive all-rounder Andre Russell is retiring from the IPL after a decade, transitioning to a "Power Coach" role for KKR from 2026. The 37-year-old cited a desire to leave a legacy and expressed deep attachment to the franchise. Russell's monumental IPL career includes two titles and numerous accolades, cementing his iconic status.

title: Cyclone Ditwah: India on high alert as 3 die in TN; death toll in Sri Lanka crosses 150
content: Cyclone Ditwah has prompted a high alert in South India, with Tamil Nadu and Puducherry bracing for potential rain and thunderstorms. The cyclone's path runs parallel to the coast, posing a threat after claiming 159 lives in Sri Lanka. India has launched Operation Sagar Bandhu, deploying relief and rescue teams to assist the island nation.

title: 5-year-old boy’s tonsils removed, mom blames Delhi-NCR pollution
content: A family in Noida faced a heart-wrenching ordeal when their five-year-old son required surgery for alarming respiratory issues brought on by pollution after relocating to the area. Struggling with relentless allergies and breathing troubles that defied treatment, the little boy's condition worsened to include swollen tonsils and adenoids.

title: ‘Mobile not allowed in school’: Class 8 student, national level skater jumps from MP school
content: A 14-year-old national-level skater in Ujjain tragically jumped from his school's third floor after being summoned to discuss his mobile phone use. The boy, who sustained severe injuries including spinal fractures, reportedly feared his parents' reaction. He was preparing for a national tournament. An investigation is underway.

title: Oregon, Ole Miss and Virginia headline best Week 14 uniforms in college football
content: Rivalry week is the perfect opportunity to gain bragging rights over a local foe . a win for the Ducks would lock up a home playoff game in autzen Stadium . here are the top uniforms from Week 14 in college football .

title: 😈 Best trolls from college football Rivalry Week
content: the final week of the college football regular season paired a number of local and long-distance rivals alike . the ability to troll your opponent on social media afterward . Iowa posted a photo of a receipt between a Hawkeyes football helmet and the Heroes Trophy .

title: Our guide to remaining Week 13 games: Matchup previews, predictions and picks
content: the rest of the week 13 NFL schedule for the 2025 season continues with some intriguing matchups . the 49ers will visit QB Shedeur Sanders and the Browns, the Chip Kelly-less Raiders will face the Chargers, and the Broncos are seeking to win their ninth straight .

title: Projecting Tuesday's penultimate CFP top 12
content: 11 of the committee's top-12 teams won during Rivalry Week . the résumés are complete, with exception of teams that will play for their respective conference championship games . a fifth and penultimate ranking Tuesday night will be the best indicator all season .

title: Survivor Series WarGames: Who is the masked man who attacked CM Punk?
content: mystery fighter interrupts main event of WarGames to help Brock Lesnar, Bron Breakker and their team win . AJ Lee pinned Becky Lynch in the women's wargames match . that's the biggest question after Saturday's Survivor Series .

title: Throwbacks from Pats, Commanders, Seahawks top NFL Week 13 looks
content: the combination includes a plain silver helmet, navy jersey and white pant look . the Baltimore Ravens wore their classic threads against the Cincinnati Bengals . it's a busy week for alternates as part of the league's John Madden Thanksgiving .

title: The Playbook: Shadow Reports, lineup locks
content: this column features score projections, over/unders, win probabilities, and easy digestible fantasy advice for seasonlong leagues and DFS . this guide should help you with all sorts of decision-making, including sit/start, last-minute waiver adds and lineup choices .

title: Norris 'disappointed' to miss out on Qatar pole
content: lando Norris was disappointed not to beat his teammate and title rival Oscar Piastri to pole position . norris will start the race in second place after aborting his final lap as he started to run wide in turn 2 . if he crosses the finish line, the championship battle will go down to final race in Abu Dhabi .
